intro: Fraxinus oxycarpa subsp. taurica, commonly known as the Crimean ash, is a deciduous tree native to the Crimean Peninsula. It typically grows to a height of 10–15 meters with a broad, spreading crown. The leaves are simple, alternate, and ovate with a serrated margin. The tree produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in catkins, followed by winged seeds. It is adapted to the semi-arid climate of its native region and is often found in forest-steppe and rocky areas.
